reviews.review_msg: My favourite class and professor to date, his assignments truly prepared you for the class and his exams were exactly the content of the lectures (harder questions of course but nothing insane). If I can tell you one thing as the key to success in this course, its study lecture slides, attend and participate in tutorial, and try hard the Wiley+!!!!
Great prof, no more comments to be made honestly.

GOAT prof fr üêê. Hard course but as someone who never gets anything, I actually understood shiz here ü§Ø. For that, Richard gets 5 BIG BOOMS ‚Äî BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM üí•.  Not as funny as I expected, but he's still the real one, the legend, the professor we needed. 

TAs? Straight-up chaos ‚Äî sassy little gremlins. Straight-up mood swings on turbo.

Richard was by far one of the best professors I've ever had at this point for the entirety of my university career. He's very kind and caring and clearly puts a LOT of effort into ensuring his students succeed. His lectures are always very well done, and I never really had any issues understanding the material he taught. He made the cours enjoyable

Richard is an amazing prof, for such a difficult course. He breaks down super complex topics and provides many practice questions for understanding. He is also accessible by email, and is very kind. Would 100% recommend Richard for BUS 251!!!

Richard was probably one of the best professors I've had at SFU. He genuinely wants you to succeed and was very clear at giving lectures. Great introduction to accounting for me. He also is engaging with the lectures and isn't boring at all. 10/10 (or i guess 5/5)

i prefer him over praise ma. richard breaks down difficult concepts extremely clearly. puts emphasis on practice, practice, practice and gives marks for completing practice assignments. you will not get confused so long as you go over his ENTIRE slidedecks every week and DO HIS PRACTICE Q'S. 

an excellent teacher given the difficult subject.

I'm a genuine person. Like all of us, I procrastinate, am lazy, etc. But this class is good because the lectures are actually quality. It's guaranteed that if you go to the lecture, you won't have to read the textbook ONCE

just read the slides and focus in class. For assignments he gives the answers in his slides as most accounting is template
Not great.
Its impossible to do bad in his class if you just pay attention. Made accounting incredibly easy. In class examples are great. Use those to study and you'll get above average everytime.
BEST professor for BUS 251 EVER!!!!!

Richard is a great professor and he cares about your success. He is happy to chat/help in office hours. He doesn't waste your time and expects the same in return. Accounting can be intimidating but his lectures and slides are great and I suggest not bothering with the textbook. I suggest relying heavily on his lecture slides and example questions.
Micheal Jordan

Richard is a great professor! He tried his best to make lectures engaging, including accounting memes, and really drove in important concepts. Nothing was unexpected on the exams, and other marks came from tutorial participation, weekly homework, and periodic knowledge checks. This is literally the only course that I've attended every lecture for.
Very good professor, loves to crack jokes in class. Makes class interesting. However he goes very quick in class so you must stay up to date with all class materials.
I really hate accounting but at no fault of Richard. Exams are fair, explanations are straightforward, and class is fast-paced without being boring. Highly recommend.
Never read the textbook, just go over lecture slides and understand all in class questions and you'll be fine. lectures are entertaining.

Really good professor. Honestly no complaints about Richard. He speaks clearly, he knows what he's talking about, he's accessible consistently, and never doesn't have an answer to a question. Just make sure you actually work on the online homework assignments and don't just rush them. It will help you for exams

Great instructor. Accounting is tough - the math is really easy but the way of thinking is hard to learn.
Class is curved so I am not sure I can say it's hard or easy.

I can imagine the class to be way more boring without Richard
Very fair. Class is on a curve but lots of people find accounting hard so if you are strong quantitatively, this will probably be an easy A for you. Definitely requires lots of time and practice.

Great professor for a tedious class. Well spoken and very punctual. Fair marker. My advice- don't waste the Wiley+ homework assignments- they are valuable and help study for the exam. Take your time with them and don't rush to look at your notes or the lecture slides. It's a good trade off to struggle in the homework but do well in the exams.

Best professor to take BUS 251 with, lectures are super engaging, its so hard to skip a lecture, lectures are content heavy but they are taught extremely well as they are spaced out. The exams are very very fair, you just need to practice from day one and you will nail this course.

Although I didn't enjoy his weekly assignments, they forced me to study the content weekly which helped me succeed on exams. The exams reflected assignments and especially his "Additional Selected Practice Problems". He is enthusiastic in his lectures and has us try problems in class. He explains concepts clearly and was helpful in office hours.
Thank you Richard!!! My first A was gave by you!

Richard was an amazing professor! I took BUS251 and I really liked it; in his tutorials your participation will be counted as attendance so make sure to participate in every tutorial! Sometimes his homework's can be challenging, however, I can assure you that if you assist to his office hours or his TA's office hours you should be fine!
Excellent! I never met a more funny, organized, and responsible instructor like him.
The best professor ever for any accounting course at SFU. If you choose others, you will regret it that much!!! Strongly recommond for all business students!
Amazing and funny prof. Richard cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Highly recommend!

Should probably be a 4 credit course given the workload. Needed to practice a lot to get good at it - so can understand why the homework was weekly. 

Richard was delightful. Worth it to have him as an instructor alone.

He is a good prof and the lectures are understandable, but the workload is pretty heave and it makes it so hard to manage. weekly assignments and knowledge test and other assignments. the class is gonna take so much of your time don't take this class if your taking a full coarse load

Honestly, accounting is not my cup of tea but accounting was my FAVOURITE course last semester. Richard is engaging and packs a lot of stuff in a 2-hour time span. I loved his approach of providing us with in-class questions to practice. If anyone can convince you to go into accounting, it's Richard.

Richard is one of the best profs I have had he makes the class more enjoyable and the dad jokes kept me engaged. he does a good job splitting harder materials into smaller sections which helps understand the materials. the midterm and final were fair too and relevant to the practice done in class which helped for the exams
Such a great guy. Explains concepts clearly, plenty of examples, and engages with the class. He's got a whole arsenal of wicked dad jokes, difficult not to laugh out loud sometimes. He's my god.

BEST PROF AT SFU! He is an amazing lecturer and is hilarious. Richard thoroughly explains each topic and has you practice right after with in class problems. Make sure you do the additional practice problems outside of class and you should do great.
Absolutely an amazing prof. He cares a lot about his class, finals and midterms are extremely fair for what is learnt in class. This guy wants you to succeed. Btw he is funny too.

One of the best professors in SFU, easy 5/5 rating. Funny lectures, and a clear syllabus, it is clear that he does care about his students, he'll talk through theories and content with his entertaining lecture slides, making accounting more fun and easier to understand, and then he'll do some practice questions along the way. Love to have him again

Keep practicing, attendance to his class is not mandatory but his tutorial is. Lectures are clear and organised.
Conclusion: HE'S THE GOAT. THE GOAT!!!
Great instructor. Never thought I would like accounting but this has been my best class so far! Not an easy class but would recommend this instructor to any Beedie student.
Great lecturer. Does a very good job of explaining the material and keeping his class engaged. His exams are very similar to his practice questions. Highly recommend taking accounting with Richard.

Amazing professor. I was really worried about bus 251, but this professor made it the easiest and most enjoyable class for me. Very interactive, gives time in class to practice what he taught, and starts each class with a joke! Attend ALL THE CLASSES, and go to him to clarify your doubts asap.

Enthusiastic and passionate prof. By far the best I've had thus far at SFU, with clear and concise explanations. Moves fast, but that is the nature of 251. I genuinely look forward to his class and his jokes (although dad-like and corny) are greatly appreciated. Makes accounting digestible and somewhat fun! Take him if you know what's good for you.

Richard is the best prof that I have had so far. He is super funny, and his lectures are very engaging. I highly recommend taking this class, you are in for a treat. He breaks down course material and makes concepts easy to understand!
Tough class. Richard makes all the difference. One of the best professors I had in my second year.

I want to emphasize that this is not an easy course. If you attend every lecture and tutorial on time, complete all assignments diligently, and review before exams, I believe you will undoubtedly gain a wealth of knowledge and have a great sense of accomplishment. Good luck.

He is one of the best professors I've encountered at SFU. His classes are extremely organized, with course materials and exercises seamlessly integrated, and all concepts are explained thoroughly. Unlike other classes where I often felt disengaged, attending this course motivated me to come to school.

Richard is one of the best professors I've encountered at SFU. His classes are extremely organized, with course materials and exercises seamlessly integrated, and all concepts are explained thoroughly. Unlike other classes where I often felt disengaged, attending this course motivated me to come to school.

Most engaging professor I ever had. He's the only prof to personally reach out to students when they do well or poorly, so it seems like he really cares about his students. Homework and exams can be challenging but this is the best it can get considering it's accounting

Richard is the best!!! 251 is not an easy course but Richard is straightforward and engaging. He even made me think about specializing in accounting. I never thought I would say that accounting could be interesting.

I LOVE RICHARD. I found accounting to be my favourite class of this semester because of the way Richard taught. His lectures were engaging and easy to follow and the in-class questions definitely helped my understanding. The tutorials were practice-based which was definitely useful. Make sure to do all the homework or else you'll lose marks fast.

Amazing professor! BUS 251 is a hard course no mater who you take it with as there's just so much content to cover. However, Richard's lectures are super engaging and makes a boring class kinda fun. He loves to engage with students and even personally reached out to me for doing well on the midterm.

Richards a great prof, and his lectures are great. I recommend taking a course with him. TAs were also great, many office hours available. Nothing surprising on the exam, as he provides a lot of material to practice. Wasn't to interested in accounting prior to this course, but I definitely am now.
Honestly, the best prof I had in the last three semesters. Tried very hard to get us excited about accounting. Funny guy and probably makes accounting as good as it can get.

This is a review for the accounting prof. Didn't like accounting but he is probably as good as it gets. Class is curved so it's really how you do compared to rest of class. Make sure you practice; questions can be tricky.
Really good Prof, Interesting lectures, a lot of homework. Some homework doesn't make sense and tests were pretty challenging.

As good as accounting can get. Clear explanations and tries to make accounting as exciting as he can. There are definitely students in this class who don't want to be here and are actively disruptive. I genuinely feel bad for the guy. Exams were fair and he was more than willing to walk me through questions in office hours.

Praise is an okay professor. She isn't horrible. I found her slides BAD, and it's hard to look over. She does care as a professor, but she makes the class more confusing than it needs to be. She tends to rush over important topics, & her exams are fair (mostly) but frustrating because you need to STUDY EVERYTHING (no good hints on what's on it).

Praise is a really kind person and she GENUINELY cares about her students and their learning experience. She incorporates Kahoots and practice problems in lectures to make it engaging, as well as recording and posting all lectures on Canvas. As long as you do the practice problems and homework assignments every week, you'll be okay!

Personally i dislike how she structures her slides and introduces topics. too much going on, she tries to use so many unnecessary graphics and jam them into everything that it's difficult to comprehend what the actual main concepts and themes are. the content itself is easy, but the prof really overcomplicates it

Truly a great professor, my personal favourite, she is so nice and cares for all students! She made accounting very easy to understand and provided manyyyy resources to learn from, WileyPlus made learning much easier. My favourite class, did very well thanks to Praise!
Great Prof. Top 3 Prof I have taken at sfu in my 4 semesters. Don't hesi to take. Everything is recorded, can't think of a single thing to ask to imrpove on it was honestly perfect.
Outstanding professor who goes out of her way to help students. I highly recommend her if you want fair exams and engaging lectures - just beware that they can be quite fast-paced sometimes.

she's a great prof, provides all the material you need to succeed and is extremely thorough. the only determinant is whether you put in effort or not. however, i dislike her lecture style; it's quite fast-paced and i find her slidedecks confusing to decipher. the amount of information can be overwhelming but just study hard and youll be fine

Praise is a great professor, her lectures are informative and engaging. Her tests can be a little tough, ensure you understand all the concepts and frequently complete practice questions. Beware of the final being 40% of the grade. Overall, very kind and caring prof.

Praise was a very fun and engaging professor overall. She cares about your success. However, she goes through the lecture material way too fast, making it really hard to keep up. Also, tests are 70% of your final grade. I wish she would put more weight on the assignments and explain concepts better because this class was challenging for me.

One of the best accounting professors out there in SFU. I took her last fall semester and the concept explained by her throughout the lecture was obvious and understandable. She is also easy to reach through email and during office hours and helps students a lot to get good grades

Praise Ma is a phenomenal professor, she is very energetic and makes lectures very engaging for a dull subject like accounting. She's very caring if you show up to her office hours she will go the extra mile to help you. Assignments on wileyplus are fair but tough at times, her in-class examples are useful. Overall a very positive experience

Praise was an amazing lecturer and I really enjoyed her teaching style, definitely take 251 with Praise. Tests were fair, wileyplus assignments weren't too challenging but they were a great practice for the tests.

Praise has been one of the best profs ive had at sfu. Her lectures and assigned readings are amazing. hw and tutorials are also super helpful. she is willing to go the extra mile to help her students succeed.

Professor Ma is wonderful. She gave weekly homework that helped me learn the concepts thoroughly, her textbook is easy to follow along and explains everything really well, her tests were fair, and listened to our recommendations/requests for how to improve the course. Take BUS251 with her for an engaging and worthwhile experience.

This was my first time taking accounting, and I was so lucky to meet Praise. Her lectures are amazing and very engaging, there are Kahoot and questions for us to work on in class that helped me understand the materials much faster. The assignments were super helpful and fast to complete too. Praise is also very welcoming and friendly!

Praise is one of the sweetest profs I have ever met. She is an amazing lecturer and somehow made accounting interesting. Her exams were fair, the assignments were not overly time consuming, and the cahoots in class helped comprehend the key concepts better. Overall, you definitely should take 251 with her
I was very impressed with her teaching prowess, she made accounting very easy to comprehend.

An absolute gem of a professor. She explains difficult concepts in an easy to understand manner. She keeps students engaged in class through Kahoot games, her exams are fair and she is very nice and approachable in general. Highly recommend taking your classes with her!
A living legend. If you can't handle the heat, get out of the kitchen. Steve is an example of Accounting upper division courses at Beedie.

Does not teach anything about accounting and already assumes you know what to do. Rambles a lot in class about Taylor Swift, Elon Musk, and how America is so great and China being inferior. You will learn more about BUS251 in youtube, just look for "Tony Bell" channel and you will have everything you need.

Just RUN
He is not a good speaker and have no passion in teaching, always degrading students tell you you are not smart enough to pass the course.
Did that one review said he is easy after failing 2 midterms lol
No no no guys. Just run...no no...
Never met this instructor made the midterm exam like this hard.....
GOOD LUCK!!!! Horrible.....
Run for your life! ! ! DON'T TAKE IT! ! Just leave him without any reason. Otherwise, you will fail from our respectful "Steve-o & Gibco" company owner :)
It was perfect, down to the nearest minute detail. Very good prof, amazing notes and challenging homework and samples. This course is not for the weak tho.

The prof is not for softies and encouragement-seeking weak-minded individuals. Yes, the course is super hard and yes, the prof makes it harder. However, I still loved every second of the 13 4-hours lectures because of the based jokes from this guy. Your grade and your ability to get along the prof will determine if BBA is really for you.
Honestly, he is actually a cool person. Just read the textbook guys. Jeez.

A true gatekeeper for Beddie School of Business. Only people with determination can pass this course. However, don't let others, even Steve, discourage you from passing the course because it is truly easy if you put in the time. Steve uses psyops big time. He is funny tho.

Accounting is already a hard subject and He confuses you more. Be prepared to study and try and understand everything for yourself, exams are hard but he makes you think they are so much harder than they are, gives handouts a lot and they help so study those, the second half of the semester is tough so be prepared. good luck.

You won't have a choice if you are at FIC. He is actually not that bad and he creates opportunities for students to do better. Start studying right away from the semester to keep up. If you do everything (reading and practicing) that he posts, then you should be good to go. Just show him that you want to learn and improve. Office hours are a mustgo
He is 'that' white guy. Does not care about any of his students. He is a racist. Does not provide any feedback. Rude; I can keep going. Please stay away from him.

On the first day of class, stated that most are going to fail because he is going to do everything in his power to make sure we fail, seems proud about it as well. You will need a lot of dedication to pass the subject. Have all the red flags a prof can possibly have, unfortunately, he's the only one teaching the subject.
Do not enroll it unless necessary!!!
The tests are very hard. He does not explain well. I understand nothing about his lecture. Reading the book makes me get higher scores compared to my peers, but I was not helped by his lectures.
BE WARE! AVOID HIM AS MUCH AS YOU CAN. He doesn't teach properly, will just read slides and not explain. He will make fun of you for not knowing the answer. NOT AT ALL HELPFUL.
Spent much time reviewing and finally found the stuff in the exam was totally differentMany things you have never met before.

He's not a harsh grader thats for sure however, dont expect the course to be easy BUS251 is not easy for anyone who never study acc before. The best way to survive his class is to NEVER get on his nerve, do homeworks, ask good and reasonable questions (dont ask random questions) and study outside class. Not the best at teaching but fair grader.
He's awesome for accounting.

The tests are fair, he gives enough additional material to pass the course The biggest disadvantage is his attitude towards students. During working hours he is actually nice and willing to help but when it comes to class... His ironic jokes r good, but each and every class he reminds students that they will fail - it's not OK
Hes speech is inspiring and youll find there is a new world of accounting!!
He is generous.
No homework at all and you will get a good grade.
Good and funny lectures
He has most organised materials and focusing on his materials is fine hehe
Organised notes
He is humorous.
He is the best professor I met
He is a good presenter.
I love his lectures very much
Hes such a nice professor and just go to his office hours!! Hell provide all helps to you!!
Nice guy
Clear lectures
Read book and understand his lectures.
Nothing we can learn during the class, learn whole stuff by self.
This is not a tough course. You can get good exam result if you do the handouts given by him. I missed 5 classes out of 13 because  his classes were very boring.
Worst prof. AVOID taking with him.
lll
Extremely nice and helpful instructor. His exam is fair and as long as you work hard, things would be fine.
To do well, you will have to read the textbook and do the tutorial questions he assigns. His exams are fair and relevant to what he teaches. No complaints
boring class. if you have another choice, do not take this professor.
I took bus251 and bus272 with him. Accounting was hard, but Organizational Behavior class was awesome - he's interesting and makes some really funny jokes.

He's not one for giving enthusiastic lectures, but he's pretty clear about what he wants you to know. The tests for this course were tough, but only because of the sheer amount of questions; the material itself was pretty basic (that's coming from someone with no interest in accounting). Be prepared to write quickly and you'll do fine!
not the best teacher for accounting

Highly recommended if you're willing to put in your effort for this class. I was hesitant in taking his class after seeing his rating but honestly he is so underrated. Accounting is usually not the easiest class but he is very clear with his explanation and very approachable. Overall, very good prof

He is a very challenging person, but once you get to know him, you start to enjoy his lectures. His lectures don't contain a lot of important details, but he makes you understand the concept as a whole.               My advice would be:1.You have to read the book. 2.You don't have to be scared of him, be on the same wavelength and you will succeed.
Not the best prof to take this course with.
Disorganized, not very pleasant. Exam determines your grade. Not recommended.

Steve's class is graded on effort. He gives quizzes in tutorial to make sure you're on top of things. Do the weekly textbook questions and learn the key concepts by heart. I got 120.5/130 on the midterm by prereading and doing all the textbook questions. Lectures didn't help me much, but they are informative to an extent and can be helpful.
Boring prof, didn't like the way he taught. Doesn't send us lecture slides, only incompleted lecture notes that we have to fill out. Almost impossible. Exams were a bit on the hard side.

Definitely knows his stuff and what he's talking about, however, lacks in the clarity department. Exams aren't bad at all if you do all homework assigned and practice questions, should guarantee you atleast a B.

Steve seems to be strict but he is nice and helpful. He responded to my email quickly. He gave a lot of exercises and practice in the class. Pay attention to the exercises in class; it will be in exams. One of the point is you MUST read the textbook. If you can, I'm sure you can get B up.
The prof expect you read all the textbook before you come to class, and expect you already know everything.  The lecture is messy, he would say something randomly when he just remembered.

Not a bad guy, not a bad prof. He doesn't explain the material as thoroughly as needed in a course like this, but the text does. You must read the text to understand the material, but you also must attend lecture because he uses examples that are also on the tests. Pasha is the TA to get for this class. He knows exactly what Steve is looking for.
Avoid if you can. Lectures are messy, unorganized, and will only occasionally focus on important material

HE SUCKS AT TEACHING. LEARNED NOTHING FROM HIM. HAD TO READ TEXTBOOKS AND WORK ON WILEY BY MYSELF. EXAM QUESTIONS COME FROM WILEY. EXAM IS EASY BUT YOU HAVE TO WORK HARD ON WILEY AND STUDY BY YOURSELF SINCE HE DOESN'T TEACH ANYTHING AT ALL SO YOU DON'T NEED TO ATTEND HIS LECTURES.
Very easy course as long as you do the weily questions. Hot prof and clear accent. extremely helpful.
Go to lectures because he does questions from the textbook that sometimes appear on the midterm and final. Overall, this course is easy as long as you put a little bit of effort into it.

Who has rated him with a perfect score? He's a horrible prof, doesn't really care about his students - he does the job for the sake of his job. Lectures are extremely pointless because he goes too fast. Do NOT take this course with him.
Only cares about his Harley Davidson. God damned Capitalists!!!

Best accounting prof. No surprises on exams at all. Hilarious prof, get him as your TA. Course is lot of work but as long you do tutorial question and wiley questions you should get an A+ unless you are one of those lazy students who just likes to complain LOL
Funny Guy, the course is tough, so no one can make it easier, he goes too fast on the slides and his time management sucks, exams are not that bad, some people had the question from before

loves that he's american (...why?) and goes on and on about it. is obviously smart and knowledgeable about business but either hates teaching, sucks at teaching or both. he grudgingly explains the basics but doesn't really get into details. i'd say avoid him, but i don't know who can make an accounting class fun/easy

he is not a good prof! the exams are brutal!!! totally tricked us on the final, went in knowing everything, came out thinking what the hell just happened!A MUST AVOID!!!! he's american and thats all he can talk about, dont do it, just dont!
Awesome prof very helpful and no surprises no exams.  He does try to scare people in the start of the semester saying the final is really hard although I found it easier than the midterm

Lecture was boring, he doesnt do a good job of teaching (I stopped going) not that helpful except for company examples he uses show up on the exams. Read the text and do the text questions to do well. Exams are more than fair just do practice. Tutorial usefulness depends on your TA but mandatory since there are quizzes.

Mr.Gibson's way of teaching isn't helpful because he tends to rush over slides quickly and only stresses on the ones that are very important.However this makes the course very overwhelming.If you are capable of learning on ur own, u shud do great because Mr.Gibson is only there for additional help.He tends to be very unapproachable.

Awesome prof! Gives lots of A+'s! Hard course, but easy exams since no surprises. Go to lectures for the extra slides that show up on the exams as essay questions. Just do tutorial and review lecture questions. MCQs can be hard though.
As long as you attend his lectures, do his assignments and read the textbook then you'll be fine. Midterm and final are no surprises.

trust me , if you need to take financial accounting take it with this guy. the course is tough to begin with but steve has no suprises on his mid & final.  YOU ALSO LEARN A HECK OF ALOT IN HIS CLASS. only go to class for his theory questions on the final otherwise just read the textbook and youll do fine.
i found him to be very very hot which was a plus, but other than that he was horrible...hard class..be prepared for the worst
No surprises on midterm or final, but make sure you know your stuff!!! Lectures are a complete bore..hes super hot tho :P
Good prof! You should take his class if you really wanna learn something. What's point of the university if you are always trying to find the easiest course?
Good guy, constantly trying to improve his teaching style.  If you study, you'll get an A. If you don't study, you'll fail (surprise surprise)... but please don't complain.

not that bad, make sure u do the practice questions b4 the exam. and read the articles he talks about in the lecture. i always fall asleep during the 1st hour of the lecture, the 2nd half is really interesting though.
easy class

Either you'll hate him or love him! I loved him!! Made lots of jokes in tutorial and was pretty chill. Don't piss him off though, or else he'll make the course hell for you! Midterm was easy as long as you do prac questions, final was pretty hard though! Got an   A+ though.
His exams aren't hard as long as you do some practice questions before exam.
Great Prof! A nice guy. He has a lot of experience in the field. If you really interest in accounting, you would appreciate him.
this class was boring and just wouldn't end. i got a B on midterm and ended up with C, even though i though i did better on final. strange, im gona ask to see the final.

His lectures are so boring, along with the dim light...just make you want to sleep. He is the only prof who allows twice attempts for online work (any other profs allow three times). Quizs all the time. The average is 77% in midterm. Final is not super hard as long as you go through text. However, if you have Nate as your TA, you should be fine.

His tone of voice is enough to make you hate accounting. He is unclear, rushes through 100-slide lectures, and is just a general pain to learn from. Luckily our TA was great, and she explained things that he glossed over. I did not like his style, attitude, and lecture delivery, and i would not suggest his class.

His teaching is ok, but he basically just read off his notes from ppt. However, lectures are mandatory because he will discuss some extra topics which will appear on mt and finals (and that worths quite a lot).  Exams are fair and no surprises if u do all your weekly assignments and go to his lectures. P.S. his monontone will bore u to tears!

Fair marker. Gives you the benefit of the doubt. don't bother taking notes in class. He moves too fast and gives you literally one second to copy down 10 pages of notes.  weekly assignments were too time consuming. each assignment had over 120 questions. no surprises on midterm and final but my class took entire three hours and still did not finish
No Comments
Best male accounting prof ever, kind nice, knowledgeable, hardworking

Very helpful professor, he is young and nice. even spend a hour for one student's question. assignment is well related with exam, midterm is not hard, but the final is disaster. Really nice grader, gives more A than others.

Very helpful and nice professor who cares about his students. Tries his best to engage the class during lectures. Course is structured well. Doing the weekly homework questions and going to lectures are crucial to doing well. Midterm and final were fair.

Very dedicated to helping students understand the material, which can be quite dry. Midterm was fair but the final was quite a bit more challenging. Lecture slides are clear and helpful. If you have to take this course, take it with him.

Despite the fact that I don't enjoy accounting, he tried very hard to make it interesting for everyone. His passion for his job is impeccable; if you were to find a model prof with good attitude and not smug, he would be the first choice. Yes he has a Chinese accent but I guess it's just a give and take. If I had a choice, I would take it again :)
highly recommend!!!!

You can tell that Wing is highly interested in the subject and wants his students to succeed! He provides simple examples to apply to sometimes complicated concepts which makes it so much easier to understand. His exams are mostly based on the lecture notes. He was able to make the bland content of this course interesting :)
GREAT PROF (despite the accent)he try his best to make everything simple and easy, just make sure you do the assignments and actually UNDERSTAND them, then your good to go..
Awesome prof!The guy who made me interested in accounting again!Very dedicated prof as well,patient and always try his best to make study material understandable to everyone.Highly recommended!

Wing, there is no "d" in Accounts Receivable. That really annoyed me. Overall the class was hard. Not a good idea to take it in the summer. Wing was alright as a professor,but his tests killed me. You might want to shop around for an easier accounting prof (if one exists).
Highly recommended. Helpful and very clear in his lectures.  Assignments are very helpful and makes good practice for the exam.

The most helpful teacher I've had yet. The class is boring but it's not his fault considering it's accounting. A very fair marker, tries to give as many partial marks as possible, and will reply to emails and questions promptly and very clearly. Great guy!

Professor Wing makes me become interested in learning accounting as he explains really clear and very helpful if you understand the assignments given. I write an email to him every week regarding the assignments, and he replies very clear! The questions for exams are also in accordance to what we learn :) very recommended!!!!
He is a very nice professor. His lecture notes are really really good. you just need to read carefully along with doing some exercises in your textbook and you will be fine :D

Excellent prof in terms of explaining concepts clearly and preparing for the midterm. TAs are super nice as well. However I (as well as many others) found that the final was extremelyyy difficult. Everything was great up until the final exam!
He is an excellent prof! everything is super clear~!!! but final was reeeeeally hard.....since compared with midterm the average was 71%

Studied 5 days non stop for the final but it wasn't enough. I did the practice questions, the tutorial questions, and questions from the notes but the final was just a killer. This isn't an easy course and only certain people with a knack for accounting will do well.
Nice prof! Final is sooo hard compared to midterm...=(( But still love Wing~

Great prof, explains everything well and gives ton of practice questions that help with the exams. She provides lectures slides and goes over them in lecture and are quite straight forward.  Also, sets up additional review sessions before final. And will weigh the final more if you do better on it than you did on the midterm!

Maureen's very kind and will answer your questions thoroughly if you go to her office hour. Midterm was relevant to textbook questions but final was much more difficult. Her 8-hour review sessions weren't helpful as the exam was nothing like the questions she covered. I would recommend her class but you definitely have to work hard.

Her slides are very vague so if you skip class, you'll really struggle with the way she teaches and how she will test you on it. She doesn't really follow the textbook and her exams are hard, but as long as you study, you should be fine. She replies emails fast & if you go to office hours, she will be there to help. She's a sweet and caring prof.

Slides contain basic concepts but some parts are too unclear and simplified, esp for midterm and final. Like learning abc or 123 and expecting complete literacy. Repeating points in the end won't help for hyper rush lectures. I understand Prof and TA want us to learn, but they are condescending and adds little encouragement. Not recommended at all!
One of the best prof in the Accounting Area...Extremely helpful and very nice.  Exams are challenging but if you do your assignments you will at least have a pretty clear idea on the concepts
Extremely clear, great notes, but difficult final...do all the assignments!
Final Exam is super hard!!
Reminds me of Ms. Frizzel from Magic School Bus
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Very friendly prof, but don't expect an easy midterm

His lecture is not quite helpful because he follows his notes while he teach... and his notes are too simple. You cant distinctly says he's an easy or hard prof b/c he is not those tough or tricky prof. he jus gives u "surprises"

It's a tough course but Spector makes it easier.  His exams are mostly calculations.  If you like theory better take it with MacDonald.  The midterm was hard but he tries hard to make things clear in lecture.  Final was simple.

good prof, probably best prof ii business admin cause he really makes ACCT interesting, he really encourages u to learn and lots of joke in his class. U will like his lecture but not exams since it's much harder then what u would expect, recomd it!

The tests are not easy, but the whole experience was better than I thought.  Very nice, knows what he's talking about.  No note taking.  The constant jokes, although lame, add a spice of life and excitement.  He actually makes accounting -somewhat- fun.

I got an A in the course, but I thought some of the exam questions were worded improperly and unfairly marked because the question was ambiguous to begin with.  He cracks bad jokes in lecture, which makes him somewhat endearing, yet I don't recommend him.

Great prof.  Friendly, approachable, patient.  He seems to like what he does and is keen on helping students understand.  When it comes to studying, review his class notes and know the homework assignments.
This has to be the nicest professor in the Faculty of BA.  Definitely take this course with him, and make sure you do all the homework assignments.
If I could give you one advice: GO OVER HOMEWORKS BEFORE EXAMS. thats basically all you have to do. He is so nice. Best prof ever.

My fav prof for sure! she is so funny and considerate of the students. Her exams are hard but she prepares you for them. She even tells you what concept to study for the biggest mark question so if you don't listen to her tips you will struggle. Very approachable during office hours and just AMAZING over all.

She is such a nice lady! Definitely one of the most caring profs Ive ever had and shes funny! Do the assigned homework questions and youll be fine for exams. Dont slack you will suffer in the class. Literally read the textbook before lecture and try the questions ASAP and youll be golden

Awesome prof! She lets you know exactly whats going to be on the midterm and final. She really wants each and every one of her students to understand and enjoy the course. There are weekly quizzes done in tutorials but that's what helps/keeps you on top of the course!

Arsineh is adorable, and its obvious she really cares about her class. Only thing I didn't like is I felt I didn't learn a lot from her. She seemed to get out of breath after an hour of lecture. lots of "talking breaks" and ending early. not what im paying for! learned a lot from the textbook, but she will tell you what's on the exam so go to class

amazing prof that really cares about students. Midterm and final are little hard but fair. course average 66% median 70%. Easy presentation and in class assignments(you get full marks if you go to her tutorials.). recommend

Make sure you attend lectures. It's a little boring and personally i find his voice a bit annoying. That aside, he shows you how to approach all the problems, exams are fair and you can learn a lot from him. overall a good prof
A VERY FUNNY PROF! GOOD TEACHING~

I'm giving the easiness a 4 because compared to other profs, Derek asks very simple and uncomplicated questions on the midterm and final. YES, learning accounting is very hard, but he doesn't throw any curveballs, just as long as you know all the material well, you will do fine. Very good, happy prof, pleasure to be in his class.
Very good prof, clear teaching, lots of office hours to help students.  Fair midterm + final, if you took Accounting 11/12 in high school, it'll be a breeze :)

Derek's lecture are quite boring, yet the material he covers in class are useless and you can depend on his lecture notes for studying midterms & final exam. Doing assignments will benefit in his course b/c it provides more clarificaion of the material. Overall, quite easy for a BUS course.

Accounting is hard but she gives us problem sets for exam practice to help us prepare. I would recommend doing the WileyPlus consistently and asking TAs questions in office hours if you have any because they will go more in depth. In lecture, Anne goes more in depth and gives real life examples. Spring 2023 was her last term at SFU.

Professor MacDonald was an amazing lecturer and was very engaging. There was lots of homework but it was good practice for the exams. She gave detailed outlines for homework and projects. Exams were super fair and she gave practice exams that were almost identical in format to the actual exams. This professor made accounting interesting.
Just bad, like every other SFU professor, don't take.

The prof was alright a little better than average. One thing that she did that I found odd was that she would post incomplete slides on canvas. This meant that you had to go through the lecture recordings which was a waste of my time. Very fair prof but didn't do anything extra to make this course memorable.
She's a really good teacher and does a good job. Her lectures can be a bit dry, but also long as you keep up with the textbook, it's pretty easy to follow along

Anne is easily one of the best profs--explains main concepts clearly, adding fascinating insight on real-world applications. So patient & kind in office hours and exams are VERY fair. Know theory&technical aspects + understand WHY info is useful to shareholders. Use wiley online questions and go to office hours--TAs & prof are so nice and helpful!!

Has many resources to help you prepare for midterm and final. Weekly quizzes and online assignments, occasional longer assignments, one group presentation, midterm, and final. Takes a lot of time outside of lecture just because of the amount of assignments and length of textbook readings.

absolutely dreaded having to take 251, but WOW Anne completely changed my mindset. An amazing prof who is experienced, fair, and straight to the point. Her lectures are the only ones I find engaging throughout, and she does a great job in making accounting interesting. I'm surprised to say that 251 is now my favorite course this semester.

Anne is really great. She doesn't mark on attendance or anything, but her lectures are very helpful. I went to all of them and really helped me get an A-. She's had a lot of experience teaching and it is clear as she is organized, professional and very knowledgable. I highly recommend her class!
she seems nice, but i really did not enjoy her class. her lectures were so dry, making it really hard to stay focused. three hours of her just blabbering on and on about i dont even know.
Best teacher I've ever had understood her class. Never took accounting before in highschool.
Really made accounting engaging, tests were fair, and all the homework was very helpful.

Anne is awesome! Took her for both 201 and 251 and is such a good and kind professor. Truly cares about her students understanding what she is teaching as well as offering outside of class help. Would 100% recommend if you can sit through lectures.

Great Professor, Ive had her for 2 courses and both were great! she explains concepts in a very decent way and her exams were more than fair as nothing was out of the blue. Do go to office hours if you're struggling as she really does help and doesn't mind going over questions with you.

This is generally a hard course but Anne makes it much easier. As long as you put the work in you'll receive a good mark. There is no midterm instead she has 4 mini quizzes worth 6% each. This is way less stressful and better than a big test. Also she will take away your lowest mark on a quiz to help boost your grade

Anne is a great prof for Accounting! She explains concepts very clearly and is quick to answer questions that come up during class. The workload is average, consisting of a short pre-class quiz every week, and an assignment every week.

Synchronous/Asynchronus lectures were pretty dry. Realized after the first quiz that you don't need to attend/watch the lectures religously to succeed. Be very prepared for the quizzes/final and read the textbook/review the lecture videos for clarity if needed.

Teaches BUS 251 from a 70% theoretical - 30% technical stand-point that will be more applicable to most students (who need to understand financial statements and documents) taking the course than other professors who teach this course from the perspective of upcoming accountants who will produce financial statements. Explains concepts well.

Anne is a fine prof. Nothing special nothing to bad. She teaches a subject that is pretty bland and doesn't do much to make it not that way but there is only so much you can do. Tutorials make or break your experience in this class. Hilton was a great TA for me. She was kind with grading and reasonable during the pandemic.

Her lectures are really boring, but she does go into more depth than the textbook. Exams are a huge time crunch and a lot of people aren't able to finish in time. I would recommend going to tutorials and making sure to keep up with the homework. Even though there is a lot, it's really important to get familiar or else you won't finish the exam. GL

I didn't take accounting in high school so I was worried about taking it in university but it actually wasn't too bad! It's a dry topic so lectures often reflected that but Anne and my TA was always open for help and feedback! The homework was only for completion so I just did as much as I could and then reviewed the textbook answers and I got an A

I've taken accounting courses in high school and this class had less homework. Anne is a good lecturer and is very clear. 251 is a difficult if you know nothing about accounting, but I think Anne makes it relatively easier compared to other profs. Would recommend!
bad lectures, bad course.
She gives a lot of challenging homework, her exams are unfair. She also laughed at one of my group member during office hour because she didn't do well on the midterm. Avoid.

So much homework! Shes nice but her lectures are boring. Accessible for help but midterms and exams are hard. Its hard to stay awake in her class. I found her homework and class not related. Tutorials are more helpful than the lecture, so make sure you go to those!

I did not enjoy her class. I don't mean this out of disrespect but she is really boring and I fall asleep every lecture. It's hard when it's a two-hour lecture with no break. The midterm was hard and it is really hard to keep up with the homework as they take hours to do. She is a nice lady, just a little boring when she lectures.
Anne is a sweet prof. However her lectures are very boring and not very helpful. I found the textbook and the tutorials to be closer related to the exam material.
Attends every lecture and relies on youtube videos to understand the material. Funny how 5 minutes videos explain so much better than her 2 hour lecture.

her lectures are so boring! She is the most boring professor I've ever had and her slides and messy and unorganized. Homework assignments take hours even if you don 't put full effort into them. A pointless class that has just done nothing but make my stress and anxiety skyrocket.

The class is meh, I mean it is accounting it's going to be pretty similar across all teachers. Coming to class really isn't all that neccesary because there is so much content to learn, most of that learning comes from the book, not the class. Also the final was extremely long, I mean at least 60% of the class was still there till the end.
her lecture is really useful and her test is not that hard.

Stopped going to lectures less than halfway through the semester and did well on the midterm and although they're not marked yet, I feel like I did just fine on the final. The textbook is helpful for practice questions/general clarification. PRACTICE as much as you can as this will really be what helps you on the exams. Seriously, just practice.

There are few who very clear with what they teach. I always understood what she was teaching in class. There is no point in missing class, firstly you've paid a lot to be there, and when you have someone teaching who has worked for the largest accounting firms (BIG 4), you HAVE to be there. Her office hours are helpful. Gotta work hard for final.

Exams are hard and there is barely any time to fully complete them. Pop quizzes but they are marked quite easy. Theory questions on exams are difficult. Lectures are dry and not necessary. Take your own notes!

Anne is an extremely professional and well-spoken lecturer. Her passion for accounting can be seen through her engaging lectures and clear explanations. BUS 251 can be a tough course for many people but she takes the time to slowly explain concepts if you get to know her. Highly recommend!

She is one of those profs that would be worth it to wait until her class is available Many people around me found BUS 251 a challenging course, but people who took this course with me taught by Anne, found her lecture great Although I had it was a 5-7 pm lecture followed by a 9-10 pm tutorial, I did not even miss a single one of them
Understand your financial statements and how journal entries affect them. If so, guaranteed A+
no just no.

Be ready for long and heavy exams with very little time.  A bunch of people didn't even get to finish the exam under 2 hours. If there was more time or less questions, I think a lot more people would have done well on her exams.
Awesome professor! She was super willing to help out and I actually learned a lot!
It was a pretty standard accounting class. She is a nice teacher and does a pretty good job, the material is just a bit inherently dry.

Anne is a really nice teacher. She is more than happy to help her students if you go to her office hours. Her exams are really long with the final exam mostly focusing on the theory of accounting. Overall, great teacher.

Anne's lectures are clear and cover the essentials. Listen to when she mentions something would be good test material - it will be on an exam! Do the assigned homework, she bases much of the exams on the homework questions. If you need help, go see her, she's very helpful.

She is a kind person; very approachable for help and questions. The midterm was fair and she provides practice prior to the midterm and final so you know what to expect. All in all good prof. Keep up with the work and understanding and you'll do fine.

Anne's lectures are clear and professional. Assignments are crucial as many technical exam questions are taken directly from the assignments. Theory questions on exams are challenging, but if you have a good understanding of the material you'll do okay on theory. Use her practice midterm and final, they're very helpful!

Anne is a fantastic prof. Her midterm is easy and there is a lot of time leftover for you to double check. Final was fair but requires quite a bit of thinking and she gives you a lot of time it feels like it should be a 2 hour exam. She is very helpful and her lectures are very useful for preparation for exams.

Wow! hardest class i have done by far! I am confused on how and why her rating is so high! This class is very hard, lots of readings, she says there is nothing unexpected and tricky but the final exam would say otherwise! The midterm was okay but the final was another story. She is a boring lecturer, her notes make absolutely no sense! avoid!
Anne is very engaging and makes accounting interesting. One of the best profs I've had so far.
Great professor. Fair exams- nothing unexpected. Lots of material to help you throughout the class. Lots of content so need to stay on top of material as it builds on itself.

Read the textbook. Do the homework. Study her lecture slides. The exams are fair and consist of the things she covers during lecture. The midterm will be a clear indicator of how well you do on the final. Don't bomb the midterm because chances are, you'll end up bombing the course.

First class I've had at SFU that was really hard.  I finished with an A+, but I found both of her exams to be VERY long and difficult.  The course content and her teaching in lectures is very clear but IMO it's a little boring.  She was pretty helpful in office hours  the one time I went, she's a quality teacher.

Anne is extremely clear with her lectures and explains all concepts extremely well. 251 is a heavy content course as even those with acct1112 need to study the material beyond chapter 23. You really need to spend time with the material , and understand what's going on. Her exams are extremely hard, the final is more difficult than the midterm.

She tries to make the content interesting and is very clear. The midterm was not super difficult however journal entries can be tricky. The final is very long and tiring. This is a course where you need to keep track of time during exams since they are very lengthy and you can run out of time if you get stuck on questions.
she actually speaks english out of all the profs out there and is clear. U will understand what shes trying to say 100% of the time although u can skip class and read her slides and still do well
Classes were really boring and there is a lot of reading to be done every week. Homework questions can also be extremely ridiculous.
Skipped a few of her lectures but most of the things on the final was mentioned in class so attend when you can.  Tests were fair.

I really don't understand why does this prof have such a high rating, because her lectures are soooooooo boring, I have to browse 9gag every 20 min in class to keep myself awake. Does she explain material well? I don't think so. Although I got a decent grade, I would not recommend taking classes with her.

This prof is amazing. I've learned many things from her in regards to accoungting in general. The textbook wasn't that necessary when studying for her exams but I think it's good to read it once after the lecture so that you can get the general concepts. The most important thing is to practice her exams more than three times at least.

She is amazing at pacing her lectures. She explains things well but the issue is that she focuses the lectures entirely on easy stuff. The homework and the exams pretty much have nothing to do with what she talks about in lecture. I hate her power points, they're impossible to follow. Her exams are fair BUT STUDY! You can never study enough.
Lecture are boring. For midterm and final practise her hw questions a lot. Midterm was fair.. final was very difficult.
GPA Killer!
PRACTICE PRACTICE PRACTICE! The midterm is really simple, and the final will tear you apart. Ended up with a B though, so not too too bad.

Taking Accounting prior to this course is very beneficial. The final was an absolute joke. Don't take her word when preparing for the mid term or final, both have extensive amount of journal entries when she said there weren't any, or they would be marked easy. By far hardest course out of the 12 that I have taken.

Very clear, helpful and approachable esp in office hours. but the content is still difficult and she does tend to go thru material fast. LONGGG exams, collecting IDs took so much time. if u didn't take acct in high school, be prepared to work really hard.

very clear in lectures and very fair on exams. Anne does not talk fast but manages to cover a lot of material. (textbook was more than 900 pages long and she almost covered the whole thing!) it's not hard to get an A in her course if you study hard or have an accounting background.
Shes a really helpful prof. Very fair in her marking scheme. Would definitely take another course with her in the future

Explains things well, but not ENOUGH. Everything she says in lecture makes sense, and then you get to the homework or exams, and it's all stuff she barely skimmed over. She's also very unclear about what will appear on exams. Do NOT take this course unless it's required.
Anne is a nice prof. This class isn't easy but if you do the homework and the additional online problems it won't be too bad.

Excellent prof! Attending lecture is very helpful, and her power point slides makes understanding the material much easier. As long as you attend class and tutorials, and do the homework, it is easy to get a good mark on both the midterm and final exams.

Awesome prof, won't mind having her for a few more classes in the future. Teaches at the right pace, very thorough in explaining concepts. Midterm was fair, do your homework then you should do well. Super nice and helpful.
Great prof. Well-spoken and perfectly paced. She explains the concepts fairly well. Attend lectures for clarification. Do her practice problems and the midterm and final shouldn't be too bad. A

Anne was very well organized. She explained the material clearly. In the beginning of the course, things get confusing because you learn about many different types of statements, but it all makes sense later on. The exams are fair- there is more writing and analysis to do than one would expect. Great prof over all.
Great prof, great class. Work through all the problems, and do them again in order to do well on the midterm and final. Always available for help! Super nice. Good course!

I really don't like accounting, but this course was even easier than Accounting 11 that I took in high school.  And this prof's midterms and finals are very straight forward and simple.  If you actually do the homework assigned it should be easy.  Personally, I found the tutorials useless but you need to attend to get homework marks.

For those without an accounting background, prepare to work your ass off. Weekly assignments are very tedious and I found my TA and textbook to be more helpful than the morning lectures. Midterm and final were fair, but definitely not something that you can cram in a night (even if you do have an accounting background)

Good prof, super helpful if you go to her office. Must do the homework to do well. She explains concepts well in lecture but doesn't actually go through technical stuff in class much, that's left to TA mainly. Exams are fair.

Very good prof. Explains the material crystal clear and provides us with various resources to ensure that we succeed in her class. Read the textbook prior to lecture, do the homework problems with effort and make use of the companion site and you will ace the course :)

Anne is such a helpful professor. I regret making this rating so much later, but after taking two classes with her, she is one of the most helpful accounting professors at SFU. The courses itself is not easy, but Anne is able to make it very understandable for her students. I highly recommend her for accounting classes.

She gives NEGATIVE marks on exams...Slow at going through lectures and then realizes her speed and rushes through the last bit - 2 slides may take an hour and then she would rush through the last 20-30 slides in the last hour

Make sure you pre-read before starting the class, the textbook is very lengthy although it's not as important. Didn't get to finish the midterm and barely finished the final and still walked out with an A. Just make sure go over the lecture recordings and notes if you want to do well on the theory questions.

Excellent Prof.  Every lecture was extremely engaging.  Basically everything Anne says makes everything much clearer.  I would recommend bus 251 with her; moreover, she is very fair when it comes to midterms and Final exams. She will not test anything that she has not stated in class.

She is one of the most dedicated professors I have had so far.  She's not those type of professors where if you ask her questions, she'd give an answer similar to the textbook.  She is so patient, and she clarifies accounting concepts.  She's willing to offer help and I think that's the key to being successful in this course. I HIGHLY recommend her

Anne is extremely helpful and patient. She is very clear in explaining, especially when you go see her in her office. The sample exams she gives out are very similar to her actual exams. Final was really lengthy. Written responses will either boost you or kill you. Be very familiar with the theories, interpretation, and financial statements!

Anne is a very nice and helpful prof. Lectures are pretty boring and tutorials were useless. She is very knowledgeable, but hard to keep interest at 8:30 in the morning. I only read the first 4 chapters of the text, then studied her notes, did the sample exams, and did the WileyPlus stuff. I found this good, and I walked away with an A-.

Nice professor. If you ask her questions she will answer you very clearly. However, she does need to improve in time management as lectures fall behind schedule. As well, her notes are too long. Notes are not supposed to look like another book. Her midterm and final are fair but lengthy, very lengthy.

Very helpful and nice prof. Tutorials and lecutres were very boring but somewhat necessary to understanding the course. She answered emails very fast when asked questions and always explained very well. Very nice lady, but i fell asleep in lecture every time.

She is very helpful during her office hour, so please see her as often as you can. Organized notes, good for exam preparation. Midterms and final are not hard, but tedious. Overall she is a nice prof.

This professor has a vast vocabulary, to the point that her notes make another textbook in addition to the some 1000 page textbook. She is unorganized, wordy and most deadly of all, boring. If you have insomnia, attend her 8:30am class. She does not deserve the same high rating as Eldar Sehic, who uses no textbook but the whole course on overhead.

How do u expect someone to listen in class 830 in the morning the recoded lectures were poor quality.  Subject was extremely boring, exams are torture outta 150 marks 10-14 page exam felt like i was writing a long research paper her notes are horrible textbook was horrible i dun understand y she gives notes that are 20pages long. this class is hell

Good professor, notes are wordy, but once you read through them you have a full understanding. Do all the questions and understand them!! Doing the 'assessing the recall' questions will enable you to do well on the theory part of exams that a lot of people have trouble with. Exams are like the sample exams, know literally everything!

very helpful prof and really cares about her students. she has a very clear voice yet too soft that can put me into sleep in 1 second. tutorials are essential if you want to achieve a good grade in this course since she just explains general ideas in lectures.
a great prof that u can learn sth

Extremely helpful.  She genuinely cares about her students.  She is incredibly knowledgeable and very clear.  Her exams will not be difficult if you are prepared.  There is no other prof like her.  Don't take 251 if you don't have her!

Very approachable. Very helpful in her office hours and goes very far to make sure you understand the material. Notes are very detailed. There's A LOT of material to know in this course and the exams do cover a lot of it. No surprises on the exams. Use the study guides on Wiley to study if you get the concepts. Use the text for examples.
Decent prof but really boring class. It was my easiest class so I didn't pay may attention to it. Assignments don't prepare you at all for the final. I basically new nothin for the final.

Anne is a very good prof and really care about her students. If you are really intersted in accounting, take her course!!!BUT, DO NOT expect you can easily have a good grade. Her exams normally much harder than other 251 profs.

Interesting class, but the proff was horrible.  I didn't like the way she taught.  Her notes were wordy and unclear.  Each lecture, she had AT LEAST 30 pages of notes.  Also, she teaches at a very fast pace, making it hard for students to follow along.
TOUGH COURSE but good prof.Homeworks are fine but exams are soooo hard.

She's one of the best profs I've had! She makes the concepts really easy to understand -> I leave the lecture hall knowing that I actually learned something (unlike some profs who are just downright confusing). An added bonus is that she has a really clear voice so that it makes her 8:30am classes more bearable. I would definitely recommend her!
THE best prof in SFU hands down, and it's not even close.  She made otherwise deadly boring accounting kinda interesting. Everything is so clear and makes sense in her class.

Don't take this class in the morning! That being said, Anne is probably one of the best profs SFU has (and she was voted in the top five by students). She is very clear, organized, friendly and caring towards her students. Textbook is SOO boring and chapters are huge so my advice is suck it up and do as much as you can bear. Anne is the best for251

Extremely clear and helpful prof. Midterm and final were very similar to textbook questions and the sample exams she gives out, but the final had a lot more theory than expected. Very well prepared and lectures were organized and on pace.
She is well organized, interested in the course, and a very good teacher.

She is the best prof I had in SFU so far. Strongly Recommended. She has super clear voice. Midterms and Finals weren't tricky as long as you do exercises. Lectures are quite boring so try to sit in the front rows.
Very clearly communicated lectures. Responds to emails very promptly. I would definitely say one of the best profs I have had at SFU

She is very clear and easy to understand. Prepares her work in class well and organized. She was also my T.A for the class and she was very helpful both in tutorials and Offiec hours. If she wasn't so good... I would probably fall asleep because the content of the course is not the most interesting... she made more realistic and challenging.
great instructor. easy to understand, available for help. I also had her as a TA and consider myself lucky.

She is extremely clear, and easy to listen to, there is quite a lot of material, but neverthless, great course, i learned a lot, and im glad i took this course. exams are quite long.. but great teacher!

Great professor. Received my first on on her midterm. Simon Zhang was my TA, extremely helpful. Great class. If you have to take this course, Macdonald the way to go. Lectures are somewhat boring, but she tries her hardest to make it interesting

She is by far the best professor in SFU. And financial accounting is probably one of the most important courses in Business department (If you can't do well in this course you will have alot of trouble in higher level BUS courses). SO be sure to take BUS251 with her
awesome
one of the easiest courses at SFU commerce.

Great notes that condense everything you need to know from the textbook. Provides hints for all assignments, and gives out sample exams. Quick responses to emailed questions. Exams don't contain any surprises, but you have to know the content well, especially for the theory questions.

Amazing prof.  This class easily could have been boring but she made it interesting most of the time and bearable the rest.  If I could get through this class without ever falling asleep she's doing a good job!  Fairly tough class, work hard and you should do fine.

The prof was great, nice, helpful. Course was alittle hard, you need to study, not a couse you can wing. the final and midterm as almost identifical to pratice final and midterm, so study them. do not use wiley plus to study, useless but good pratice to see if you know the material. careful the mutiple choice is hard.

A good prof! Very willing to help you if you go to her office hours or email her. The course is quite hard so study hard. She expects alot on theory answer portion but if you know your stuff it will be okay. The notes are not too detailed but she goes thru the notes with the class and use examples to explain. My TA Brian is nice !!
prepared, excellent lecturer and she is so professional! but exams are too long & tough.  Assignment Qs are not quite similar to that of the examss..

She has very clear idea to accounting and teachs very well. Also ok with the exam, just time is tight. You should do as much as practice you can and focus on her notes and what she taught in class, then you will be ok in the exams.

Took 319 with her as well. She will teach something in class very well but her exams are KILLER. The averages are always in the 50's to 60's range. She appears to be all nice and kind but when you write the midterm you will be shocked. Her finals are 10x worse than anything you will see in business.

Good prof. Explains well. Final exam is easy but very LONG. 8:30am class so that sucks, hard to concentrate. Do not get Sara for a TA she is horrible. Do your readings and homework and you'll be fine. Stupid course content, but pretty good prof.
A very good prof! Nicely explain lecture materials and good use of examples. The exams were hard though, especially her final. I didn't have enough time to finish.

I didnt know that how she was good when i was taking 251 but now i realize that she was awesome good at that time compare to my 254 prof now. She was extremely good and helpful. if you go to see her in her office, she is even better. knows her stuff so much and very clear. I miss her now!! she is a fair prof.
Excellent, very experienced prof. She's extremely fair. If you work hard, even if you have no accounting background, you can do well. Having her as a TA is a bonus!

she is the best one at sfu! very clear, nice, and if you go to her office, she spends all the time until you understand. great notes, deep explanation. all good except its a 8 30 morning class:) but still worth.

that was my first accounting class and i was lucky to have her as my prof. very clear, fair exam, but i was little bit hard sitting in a lecture room in the morning 8 30 am listening her lecture for 2 hrs lol, but good prof.

Anne is one of the best professors I have had  I had her as my TA which was even better, she's clear,tries to make the class relevant and interesting . Her exams aren't difficult at all, they're doable if you keep up with assignments & when she says pay special attention to soemthingt...it's going to be on the exam! Ane she dresses very well!

she's a great prof but classes were a bit dry I mean they are 2 hours long to begin with, so imagine sitting there listening to someone talk and talk about ACCOUNTING of all boring things..lol I would've liked the class to be more interactive...TAs are really bad so make sure that u have a good TA and if you don't move to another TAs tutorial

Anne is a very good prof. She's helpful and the lectures were clear. Her exams were a bit hard, but it's fair. It's not hard to get good grades as long as you do and understand the assignments and the sample exams.

Fabulous Prof.! Excellent attitude towards students!  Very clear Lec.and notes. Though the concept itself is not that interesting, she brings in lots of interesting stories to make the material as interesting as possible. Totally reachable both in OF.Hour and through email plus very helpful! Highly recommend!

Anne is a very nice professor. She is very clear in her lectures. Homework was marked on effort, and she helped by giving us hints for each of the homework questions. Her exams are quite long. Make sure you understand the theory because a lot of students don't do well on that part. I highly recommend her as a prof.

Exams are hard, focuses more on theory than journal entries on the final which was very stupid, watch out for that on the final. She's a very nice person and knows her stuff inside out but her exams are too hard.
for everyone who thinks this course is hard, maybe try studying..  This course is easy as long as you understand the main concepts and have a bit of commonsense..

Just done the exam!  Anne = very clear, professional, nice!  Just love the way she speaks, not too fast and clear!  Exams are okay, hard in a way that itz too long!  If therez more time, most questions can be figured out~  Anne is a preferred teacher!  Strongly recommend to take her courses!
Very clear notes and lectures.  Exams are challenging, so study hard!
extremely boring lectures, the course is hard to concentrate in unless you actually like accounting.  she is very helpful but the course is just****ty.

this class is hard if you never had any accting exp. but she teaches very well. very clear and organized lectures. i failed the midterm but i managed to pull my mark up to a B. read the textbook, do all questions and expect a B or higher. very helpful. even available on sundays!
AWESOME prof! Incredibly clear, available for extra help, gave tons of practise questions (with answers!).  best prof I've had so far at SFU!
Very good prof.  Good notes.  What she says is going to be on the midterm is on the midterm! Sample midterm also very beneficial.

She is willing to give extra help when needed. Her notes are clear. She always gives you interesting and stimulating questions in the lectures though most of them are not related to the exams.  Overall, a professional and nice prof I've ever met.

Fabulous prof.  Everything is explained clearly, very approachable and helpful during office hours.  Knows the subject very well and very enthusiastic.  Not hard course if you understand the underlying principles of accounting and can think and analyze.  She expects this during her fair exams.
Very nice prof. Tough exams. She's clear but didn't feel I learned a lot from her. especially after taking with Alain Duncan for another acctg course, Anne's not as helpful.
accounting sucks like a giant sucking machine that is meant to suck. but anne is nice.  no present value calculations...i still have no idea what that is
An easy A! she's an excellent prof! the course is easy to comprehend as it's the introduction to accounting. Not bad at all!
No Comments

Its a shame that her class was scheduled at 8:30 am, otherwise I would have definitely attended more often.  Her teaching style is quite effective and clear, however her lecture notes are available online, so sometimes it seemed a waste of time attending lectures. However, a good prof nonetheless.

Great proffessor.  Clarifies everything and makes difficult concepts simple to understand.  Has a great working knowledge of the subjects and can add anecdotal information to make the course more interesting.
she is clear on everythin.So helpful if u wanna specialize in accountin

I took her class a few semesters back.  But after taking more courses with more profs, I just have to say that Anne is definitely one of the better profs out there. Very well prepared, motivated to teach, and just plain nice.  Very clear at teaching her material.  Awesome prof.
She's really nice. Though she goes through the materials rather slow, she's clear on everything. When you ask her questions, she takes time and effort to answer you the best of her abilities.
The best prof in SFU!! Clear note and fair exam!!!
friendly & helpful, knowledgeable, clear. Hard exams. Focus more on theory. If you like calculation, don't take it w/ her.
i like to take her bus319, but not available this summer. i like her lecture, cause her English is so clear, so beautiful, I just enjoyed listening to it.
she is very helpful if you ask for her help. her teaching style is great, she knows her stuff well. her exams are hard, but just study thoroughly for them.
anne is a GREAT prof!! so glad tht i took bus251 with her...but she gives hard exams!!! u have to know ur stuf to finish the exam in time^^
Not bad. a really helpful instructor. She's very thoughtful.

she is really clear and knows what she is talking about. the course is not easy but if u study then not a big problem. I got A+ in this course. the exams are reasonable and you really learn sth. nice prof, nice course.
she's helpful
Big Mac is a great Prof although talks abit slow. Make lots of examples out of MacDonald... all those subliminal messages..... must be sent by MacDonald.. Lots of work, tough exams ...
must have multi-linear thinking to do the exam. the answers are not very direct. and the mnultiple choice are tricky
excellent prof (nice, helpful, knows what she is teaching)...hard midterm and final exam but you will be fine as long as u study HARD...absolutely loved this course...
Great teacher, materials in this course are pretty easy but must study. I would love to take another course with her.
Pretty easy course, if u don't get a B or above, I suggest you should change your majors
Tough course, don't miss lectures.  Does not teach enough important stuff
No Comments
Even though the course demands lots work, but the course itself is very easy and her exam are give away if you did all the assignments..
Lectures are hard to stay awake in, but printed notes make up for it. Very helpful outside of lecture. Has clear knowledge what she's talking about.
Very clear and helpful. Exam was a bit hard, but not tricky.
Very good prof, very helpful
excellent prof at explaining.very clear and exams are very fair
kinda boring
Best Accounting Prof at SFU. Very fair, clear, and helpful.
nice, can hand in your assignments even it's 2 weeks late. Not an easy course.
hard course and quite competitive
Nice lady, relatively clear lectures.
I will rate her again after I had my midterm :P
Great prof, easy to understand
makes accounting more boring than it already is
She was quite good
helpful yet moderate diffculty on midterms and finals
Although very helpful, she is very boring. A lot of students sleep and skip.
Very good in 251, needs to tighten the material in 319 up a bit
The lecture is boring. If you want to get high grade, be sure to read books, go to lectures, do questions he suggested and be active at class. I did all of these, and get an A.
